issues.description: The problem statement (UML and instructions) requires a public constructor for Ride that takes the attributes (name: String, abbreviation: char) in that order. The solution repository's RollerCoaster, LaunchedDropdownTower and other subclasses call super(name, abbreviation), implying Ride must provide a matching constructor, but solution_repository/src/de/tum/in/ase/Ride.java defines the attributes and getters but does not declare any constructor. This omission makes the provided solution inconsistent with the specification and will cause compilation errors and confusion for students trying to follow the intended design (they are told to implement the Ride constructor but the solution reference omits it while subclasses expect it).
issues.suggested_fix: Add the required public constructor to Ride with the parameters in the order specified by the UML: public Ride(String name, char abbreviation) { this.name = name; this.abbreviation = abbreviation; }. Ensure the solution repository's Ride.java includes this constructor so subclasses calling super(name, abbreviation) compile and the solution matches the problem specification.
